The Big Sing is a Come-and-Sing of Handel’s Messiah</em>, which raises money for the Bethany Christian Trust’s Stop Homelessness </em>campaign. The project ran for the first time last year under the baton of award-winning conductor Tom Butler and was an enormous success, raising over £1300 for Bethany, which provided 87 beds for the homeless last winter.

[caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="301"]<img class=" " title="The cheque handover following the Big Sing 2011." src="http://eums.eusa.ed.ac.uk/wp-content/uploads/images/h500/projects/bigsing2011_cheque.jpg" alt="The cheque handover following the Big Sing 2011." width="301" height="300" /></a> The cheque handover following the Big Sing 2011.[/caption]

As well as raising money for the charity, the event promotes the fantastic work that Bethany does towards ending homelessness and we believe they deserve the widest possible audience for this cause. It is also an event to get people of all ages enthused about singing; we are particularly keen this year to increase the number of teenage participants.

If you’d like to get involved in the Big Sing 2012, please click here</a>. You can find out more about the Bethany Christian trust through their website. Or if you are part of an organisation which might like to get involved in the Big Sing, then please send an email our Community Relations Manager at community@eums.org.uk</a>.

Check back to our website or follow our twitter feed</a> (hashtag #bethanybigsing</a>) to get the latest information.

Bethany’s mission is to relieve the suffering and meet the long term needs of homeless and vulnerable people. Every year Bethany helps over 4,000 people to find, equip and maintain a home, overcome addictions and tackle other social and educational barriers which prevent them from living a full and healthy life.</em>

Bethany offers shelter and so much more besides, working with people to address the root causes of homelessness so they can move on into independent living. Bethany gives homeless and vulnerable people hope and a future. Watch the video to find out more and get a feel for the campaign.</em>
